intro: Kyllinga pellucidolucida, commonly known as the glassy spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features slender, upright stems that are often covered in a waxy, translucent coating, giving it its common name. Its small, clustered inflorescences consist of numerous tiny, three-ranked spikelets. Kyllinga pellucidolucida typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
